cyclone.name: MARCO
cyclone.current_location: about 115 miles ESE of Cozumel, Mexico
cyclone.trajectory: moving north-northwest today, then turning northwest across the central Gulf and aiming toward the southeastern-to-central Louisiana coast early next week
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southeastern Louisiana coast, near or just west of Plaquemines Parish

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch from Punta Herrero to Cancun, Mexico
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning from Punta Herrero to Dzilam, Mexico
weather_observation.impacted_coast: north-western Gulf coast from southeast Louisiana westward to upper Texas
weather_observation.wind: Gusty tropical-storm-force winds (up to 35-45 mph) possible late Monday into early Tuesday
weather_observation.storm_surge: Onshore flow could drive 3–5 ft of surge along Plaquemines Parish exposed coasts and lower Mississippi River
weather_observation.rainfall: Heavy rain bands could deliver 3–6 inches with localized higher totals, leading to flash-flood concerns
weather_observation.other_hazards: Elevated seas and wave heights in approaches, possible river flooding, and short-fuse tornadoes in outer rain bands
